result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin M Hoard

records.addlTxt: Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant. ($100.00) LW

Defendant Kevin M Hoard in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Kevin M Hoard.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for plea and sentencing.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered case DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  Court further ordered any bail on deposit shall be returned to poster.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated October 4, 2022; received and filed.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 30th, 2022
Pretrial Release Conditions Order - signed and filed

Defendant Kevin M Hoard in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Kevin M Hoard.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Discussion held regarding defendant's open cases. Defendant has a felony matter in Branch 2 and will be seeking a global offer and request the court to authorize transfer. Court authorizes transfer to Branch 2 for purposes of a global resolution, if accepted. 
Discussion held regarding JusticePoint discharge. JusticePoint monitoring to continue with the same conditions. Order signed and filed. 
Court forfeits $100.00 of the cash bail on deposit. $650.00 cash bail on deposit remains.
Case adjourned to Br. 2 for scheduled plea and sentencing. No new court date set in Br. 13.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Discharge Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Status Report received and filed.

Defendant Kevin M Hoard in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kevin M Hoard appeared by video means with Attorney.
Defense counsel has not received discovery and offer and requests additional time to receive and review. Defense counsel informed the Court that the defendant has a pending felony matter in Branch 2.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services STATUS Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
received and filed.

Defendant Kevin M Hoard in court without counsel.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case is scheduled for a scheduling conference. SPD has not appointed counsel at this time. Matter adjourned for status of counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.
22RM025723  Actual Date Bond Posted with *SHERIFFS 5-18-2022
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kevin M Hoard in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Kevin M Hoard in custody.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kevin M Hoard appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
